description: Sample CodeRabbit comment formats for testing parser recognition. CodeRabbit uses specific emoji patterns to indicate severity levels.

critical_security.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üî¥ Critical_

Security vulnerability: Hardcoded credentials detected.

Never commit secrets to source control.

```python
# Bad
AWS_SECRET = "AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE"

# Good - use environment variables
AWS_SECRET = os.environ.get("AWS_SECRET_KEY")
```

<details>
<summary>Why this matters</summary>

Hardcoded credentials can be extracted from version control history and used maliciously.
</details>

major_bug.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_

Potential null pointer exception.

The `user` object may be null if the query returns no results.

```python
user = get_user_by_id(user_id)
if user is None:
    raise UserNotFoundError(user_id)
print(user.name)  # Safe now
```

minor_style.body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_

Consider using f-strings for better readability.

```python
# Current
message = "Hello, " + name + "!"

# Suggested
message = f"Hello, {name}!"
```

informational_praise.body:
## Summary

Great implementation! The code is well-structured and follows best practices.

### Highlights
- Excellent error handling
- Clear naming conventions
- Good test coverage
informational_praise.note: Without explicit severity markers, CodeRabbit comments are classified as AMBIGUOUS

nitpick.body:
_üßπ Nitpick_

Optional: This import is unused and could be removed.

```python
# Can be removed
import unused_module
```

trivial.body:
_üîµ Trivial_

Consider adding type hints for better IDE support.

```python
def process_data(data: dict[str, Any]) -> list[str]:
    ...
```

This is optional but improves code maintainability.

walkthrough_summary.body:
## Walkthrough

This PR adds a new user authentication module with the following changes:

- `src/auth/login.py`: New login handler
- `src/auth/session.py`: Session management
- `tests/test_auth.py`: Unit tests for authentication

## Changes

| File | Summary |
|------|--------|
| `src/auth/login.py` | New login endpoint |
| `src/auth/session.py` | JWT session handling |

---

<details>
<summary>Additional context</summary>

This is an automated summary generated by CodeRabbit.
</details>
walkthrough_summary.note: Walkthrough summaries without explicit severity are AMBIGUOUS in the parser
